[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [Cross-Function: encode/decode symmetry] Can a message be encoded and then decoded to produce a different message or fail to decode, breaking round-trip invariants critical for network consensus? (Critical)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [Cross-Function: magic number handling] If different magic numbers are used in encoding vs decoding, can messages from one network be accepted as valid on another network, causing chain splits? (Critical)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [Cross-Function: checksum bypass] Could an attacker craft messages where the CheckedData checksum validation passes but the underlying payload is corrupted or malicious? (Critical)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [Cross-Function: command string case sensitivity] Are command string comparisons (lines 176-198) case-sensitive, or could 'VERSION', 'Version', and 'version' all be treated as the same command causing ambiguity? (Medium)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [DoS: nested vector allocation] Can deeply nested data structures within NetworkMessage variants cause stack overflow or excessive heap allocation during recursive deserialization? (High)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [DoS: cursor allocation] Does creating a RawDecoder with Cursor::new(raw_payload) on line 175 copy the entire raw_payload vector, doubling memory usage for large messages? (Medium)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [DoS: repeated decode attempts] Can an attacker flood the node with malformed messages that fail late in deserialization, wasting CPU on partial parsing before error detection? (Medium)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [Function: CommandString::consensus_encode()] [Buffer Bounds] Does the copy_from_slice on line 48 have proper bounds checking, or could strbytes.len() being exactly 12 cause an off-by-one error? (Medium)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [Function: CommandString::consensus_decode()] [Array Bounds] Is the [u8; 12] array on line 56 guaranteed to be exactly 12 bytes, or could varying decoder state cause truncation or extension? (Medium)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [Determinism: Vec serialization order] Do the Vec<T> serializations for Addr, Inv, GetData, NotFound, and Headers maintain deterministic element ordering, or could reordering cause checksum mismatches? (High)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-common/src/deps_common/bitcoin/network/message.rs] [Determinism: Alert payload] Is the Alert variant's Vec<u8> payload deterministically serialized, or could different byte orderings or lengths encode the same logical alert differently? (Medium)
